sentences.english: I am quiet, she is humming, When the Stars Go Blue.
sentences.chinese: 我沉默不语，她时而叹息，此刻繁星也变得愁闷。

sentences.english: She would have been sad, if sadness had been possible to her.
sentences.chinese: 如果她有可能愁闷的话，她会发愁的。

sentences.english: Change your laughter to mourning and your joy to gloom.
sentences.chinese: 将喜笑变作悲哀，欢乐变作愁闷。

sentences.english: And in the morning when Joseph came to them he saw that they were looking sad.
sentences.chinese: 到了早晨，约瑟进到他们那里，见他们有愁闷的样子。

sentences.english: And Joseph came in unto them in the morning, and looked upon them, and, behold, they were sad.
sentences.chinese: 到了早晨，约瑟进到他们那里，见他们有愁闷的样子。

sentences.english: Zhang Liao returned to Hefei, his heart heavy over the loss of Wan.
sentences.chinese: 张辽为失了皖城，回到合淝，心中愁闷。

sentences.english: When Joseph came to them the next morning, he saw that they were dejected.
sentences.chinese: 到了早晨，约瑟进到他们那里，见他们有愁闷的样子。

sentences.english: His illness caused me to feel gloomy.

definition: hundred knots of worry in one's intestines (idiom); weighed down with anxiety
to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
to suffer from pent-up frustrations/mental knot/emotional issue
